story.title: CPS Public Hearing: Nash / ACT Co-location
story.description: A hearing for the proposed co-location of ACT school on the campus of Nash. The schools would operate in separate buildings while sharing several amenities. Held in the board room of the Chicago Public Schools administration building. Wednesday, January 25th, 2012 8:00 - 10:00 PM

author.name: Josh Kalov
author.bio: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related. Iâ€™m moving my stories to Wakelet https://wakelet.com/@joshkalov

quote.text: Bolted to the floor seats in CPS board room unfortunate. Looks like less audience seats than upstairs.

meta.text: Bolted to the floor seats in CPS board room unfortunate. Looks like less audience seats than upstairs.

quote.text: I was off on the presiding officer's name for the Kipp-Nash hearing. It was Philip Bronstein - http://goo.gl/nGVdE (Bio) #cps

meta.text: I was off on the presiding officer's name for the Kipp-Nash hearing. It was Philip Bronstein - http://t.co/Qo8xZk6F (Bio) #cps

quote.text: Fairly small crowd here as the hearing begins #cps

meta.text: Fairly small crowd here as the hearing begins #cps

quote.text: So ACT is moving from 6-12 to 6-8? New school will be run by KIPP?

meta.text: So ACT is moving from 6-12 to 6-8? New school will be run by KIPP?

quote.text: Sorry I should have said 5-8 not 6-8

meta.text: Sorry I should have said 5-8 not 6-8

quote.text: Nash and ACT would be in different buildings on same campus.

meta.text: Nash and ACT would be in different buildings on same campus.

quote.text: Patricia Taylor now speaking about how Nash campus can support both schools.

meta.text: Patricia Taylor now speaking about how Nash campus can support both schools.

quote.text: Main building & annex building completely separate. There is also a fieldhouse on campus.

meta.text: Main building & annex building completely separate. There is also a fieldhouse on campus.

quote.text: Parking & auditorium would be shared.

meta.text: Parking & auditorium would be shared.

quote.text: $13 million in renovations that supposedly benefit both schools.

meta.text: $13 million in renovations that supposedly benefit both schools.

quote.text: Someone shouts out "FIX OUR SCHOOLS"

meta.text: Someone shouts out "FIX OUR SCHOOLS"

quote.text: 1st public speaker is parent saying they should "fix the schools now"

meta.text: 1st public speaker is parent saying they should "fix the schools now"

quote.text: Speaker 2 also saying fix our schools. "you have an education, fix our schools. YOU WILL NOT EDUCATE THEM"

meta.text: Speaker 2 also saying fix our schools. "you have an education, fix our schools. YOU WILL NOT EDUCATE THEM"

quote.text: "kids afraid to go to school^

meta.text: "kids afraid to go to school^

quote.text: Next speaker now after a little outburst.

meta.text: Next speaker now after a little outburst.

quote.text: Next speaker parent with 3 kids at KIPP. have to wake up at 5:30 because KIPP is so far away. "Austin needs KIPP"

meta.text: Next speaker parent with 3 kids at KIPP. have to wake up at 5:30 because KIPP is so far away. "Austin needs KIPP"

quote.text: This speaker works for KIPP. "Really excited to return to our original starting place "

meta.text: This speaker works for KIPP. "Really excited to return to our original starting place "

quote.text: Next, parent of 8th grade Kipp student. says KIPP needed in Austin. Not everyone in Austin can afford private school

meta.text: Next, parent of 8th grade Kipp student. says KIPP needed in Austin. Not everyone in Austin can afford private school

quote.text: "she loves her teachers. I KIPP is teaching a new way that is engaging kids"

meta.text: "she loves her teachers. I KIPP is teaching a new way that is engaging kids"

quote.text: "they start talking about college in 5th grade. "

meta.text: "they start talking about college in 5th grade. "

quote.text: Next, Kipp 7th grade parent. "Love long day. Child is excited to go to school. "

meta.text: Next, Kipp 7th grade parent. "Love long day. Child is excited to go to school. "

quote.text: "Will change future generations. Feel very fortunate to be able to send child to Kipp "

meta.text: "Will change future generations. Feel very fortunate to be able to send child to Kipp "

quote.text: "question shouldn't be why Kipp not why not Kipp. Why shouldn't parents have a choice"

meta.text: "question shouldn't be why Kipp not why not Kipp. Why shouldn't parents have a choice"

data.text: That should say "question shouldn't be why Kipp, should be why not Kipp."

quote.text: "talk about college from day 1"

meta.text: "talk about college from day 1"

quote.text: Next, parent 8th grade Kipp. "Kipp is about families. They care about entire community "

meta.text: Next, parent 8th grade Kipp. "Kipp is about families. They care about entire community "

quote.text: Next, mother of 5 sons attended neighborhood schools. All went to college

meta.text: Next, mother of 5 sons attended neighborhood schools. All went to college

quote.text: "when I hear these cash phrases, Kipp has longer school day but scores not better"

meta.text: "when I hear these cash phrases, Kipp has longer school day but scores not better"

data.text: Catch phrases, not cash phrases. She was referring to the "buzz" words that get attention lately "longer day", etc.

quote.text: "if you want to give us choice, how about a magnet zchool. Kipp is not performing "

meta.text: "if you want to give us choice, how about a magnet zchool. Kipp is not performing "

quote.text: Husband of previous speaker now. "Current Kipp campus is level 3 school. "

meta.text: Husband of previous speaker now. "Current Kipp campus is level 3 school. "

quote.text: He has a map showing magnet schools in wealthier community compared to Austin with none.

meta.text: He has a map showing magnet schools in wealthier community compared to Austin with none.

quote.text: Talks about emmit using same room for lunch & gym

meta.text: Talks about emmit using same room for lunch & gym

quote.text: Brings up NCLB saying parents would legally have choice to move into school

meta.text: Brings up NCLB saying parents would legally have choice to move into school

quote.text: There was an understanding that ACT would be on the suspension for 2 years after being closed.

meta.text: There was an understanding that ACT would be on the suspension for 2 years after being closed.

quote.text: How do you naasure school that has been dormant for 2 years

meta.text: How do you naasure school that has been dormant for 2 years

quote.text: Asking if ACT properly replied to be reinstated/renewed.

meta.text: Asking if ACT properly replied to be reinstated/renewed.

quote.text: Next speaker is a Kipp teacher for 7 years. "90% of grads enrolled in 2 or 4 year college "

meta.text: Next speaker is a Kipp teacher for 7 years. "90% of grads enrolled in 2 or 4 year college "

quote.text: Talking about looking at data when students come in in 5th grade & look at growth thru 8th grade

meta.text: Talking about looking at data when students come in in 5th grade & look at growth thru 8th grade

data.text: They look at test scores, grades, and other data when the student enters their school in 5th grade. The way I understood it is that they then are looking at the growth by the end of 8th grade.

quote.text: That was last speaker signed up.

meta.text: That was last speaker signed up.

quote.text: Seems like KIPP teachers/parents seem to truly believe they are providing a good (better?) education

meta.text: Seems like KIPP teachers/parents seem to truly believe they are providing a good (better?) education
